ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Unilateral Ménière's disease
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of episodic vertigo, roaring tinnitus, aural fullness, and sudden SNHL. Audiometric data (recruitment on reflexes, steep ABR latency-intensity function) confirms a cochlear site of lesion.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Assess hearing thresholds and configuration of loss.
Evaluate speech recognition abilities, which may be disproportionately poor in Ménière's.
Assess middle ear function to rule out conductive pathology.
Test for recruitment and help differentiate cochlear from retrocochlear pathology.
Evaluate neural integrity and rule out retrocochlear lesions like acoustic neuroma.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient exhibits a moderate-to-severe sensorineural hearing loss in the right ear with extremely poor speech recognition (34%), while the left ear is normal. Tympanometry is normal bilaterally. Special tests (Acoustic Reflexes, ABR) indicate recruitment and a cochlear site of lesion, consistent with Ménière's disease, rather than a retrocochlear pathology.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Moderate-to-severe SNHL (40-70 dB HL), flat to gently sloping. Left ear: Normal thresholds (0-10 dB HL).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: SRT 70 dB HL, SRS 34% (extremely poor). Left ear: SRT 5 dB HL, SRS 100%.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal Type A bilaterally (Static compliance: RE 0.9 cc, LE 0.65 cc).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Present bilaterally. Right ear reflexes present at 100 dB HL (normal HL levels), indicating a low sensation level and recruitment.

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: Right ear: All waves prolonged but interpeak latencies normal; steep latency-intensity function for wave V (suggests cochlear recruitment). Left ear: Normal.

tests.name: TEOAE
tests.result_summary: Absent in the right ear; Present in the left ear.

tests.name: Tone decay test
tests.result_summary: Right ear: 15 dB decay in 60 seconds (minimal). Left ear: 5 dB decay. Not indicative of retrocochlear pathology.

proposed_items: Referral to an otologist for medical management
Longitudinal testing to monitor for fluctuation or progression
counseling_actions: Explain the cochlear nature of the hearing loss and its relation to the symptoms (roaring tinnitus, fullness).
Discuss the diagnosis of Ménière's disease and the role of endolymphatic pressure.
Clarify that the parents' hearing loss is likely age-related and unrelated to this condition.
Explain that difficulty hearing in groups is typical for severe unilateral loss and reliance on the normal ear.

escalation.rationale_short: Referral required for medical management of suspected Ménière's disease and vestibular assessment.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor for fluctuation in hearing or progression of the disease.
